evs.analysisunits
Class VerificationUnit

java.lang.Object
  evs.analysisunits.AnalysisUnit
      evs.analysisunits.VerificationUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProgressMonitorInterface, java.lang.Comparable
public class VerificationUnit
extends AnalysisUnit
implements ProgressMonitorInterface

A Verification Unit comprises the location, time and attribute for which verification will be conducted. A single verification unit stores one location, time-series and attribute. NOTE: it is critical that any change in a verification unit is coordinated with its parent aggregation unit if it exists because aggregation units may only comprise verification units with common properties. The aggregation units are accessed by calling getAggregationUnits(). The children verification units are accessed by calling AggregationUnit.getVerificationUnits().

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

Constant Field Values

lastPairFirstLeadCount

protected int lastPairFirstLeadCount
Number of pairs at the first lead time for the last set of pairs read. This is used by AggregationUnit.computeMetricsByAveraging(java.util.Vector)

getSampleSizeConstraint

public double getSampleSizeConstraint()
Returns the fraction of pairs required at each lead time for that lead time to be included in the verification results. The fraction falls in [0,1] and is relative to the average number of pairs found across all lead times after applying all conditions and any temporal aggregation.

Returns:
the sample size fraction

hasVerifiableSupport

public boolean hasVerifiableSupport()
Returns true if both the observed and forecast support are null or if they are both non-null and equal or if the support can be changed, false otherwise. Null support is allowed for both the observed and forecast support under an *assumption* of equal support.

Returns:
true if verification can be performed with existing support information

isVerifWindowInValidTime

public boolean isVerifWindowInValidTime()
Returns true if the time system for the verification window is forecast valid time, false if using issue/basis time. By definition, observations are always in valid time. Pairs and forecasts may be in issue time/basis time.

Returns:
true if the verification window is in forecast valid time, false if issue/basis time

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

deepCopy

public VerificationUnit deepCopy(boolean copyMetrics)
Creates a deep copy of the current verification unit with its basic parameters. If an aggregation unit is present it is not copied. Optionally, the metrics may be deep copied. In most cases, the metrics SHOULD be deep copied. However, in some cases this is not necessary, and this is the most time-consuming part of deep copying.

Specified by:
deepCopy in class AnalysisUnit
Parameters:
copyMetrics - is true to deep copy the metrics
Returns:
a deep copy of the current unit

isAggregationCandidate

public boolean isAggregationCandidate()
Returns true if the current unit is a candidate for aggregation. A unit becomes a candidate for aggregation once it has dates, a forecast lead time and period, observations and forecasts with corresponding time systems and a set of verification metrics.

Returns:
true if the verification unit is a candidate for aggregation

aggregationEquals

public boolean aggregationEquals(VerificationUnit unit,
                                 boolean checkRefPars)
Returns true if all of the parameters of the input unit and the current unit match for aggregation purposes. Both units must return true when calling isAggregationCandidate(), as this ensures that all required parameter values have been set. Once achieved, the check here involves a limited subset of parameters, namely the variable ID, the forecast lead time, the verification timestep, and period, the temporal aggregation functions and the verification metrics (including their parameter values). NOTE that no check is made on verification conditions, such as variable value or date conditions. Whether checks are made on the reference forecasts defined for skill scores can be controlled by an input parameter; for example, if checking as part of a code block that changes the names for reference forecasts, no check on reference forecasts may be desired.

Parameters:
unit - the input unit
checkRefPars - is true to check reference forecast parameters associated with metrics
Returns:
true if all parameters match

getPairs

public PairedData getPairs()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           PairedDataException
Returns a set of paired observations and forecasts associated with the current verification unit or throws an exception if no paired data source has been defined or is otherwise unreadable. Performs any change of support on the pairs as specified by the current and required support of the VU and returns paired forecasts and observations whose values are in a common support. If the support is undefined, it is assumed to be common.

Returns:
the paired data in a common support or assumed common support
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
PairedDataException

getConditionedPairs

public PairedData getConditionedPairs(boolean applyValCond)
                               throws ConditioningException
Applies any conditions associated with the current verification unit to the verification pairs and returns the reduced set of pairs that satisfy those conditions. Also aggregates the input first if required (i.e. if an aggregation resolution has been defined). The conditions applied may include conditions on the times, the forecasts or the observations. Throws an exception if the paired forecasts and observations have not been defined for all of the dependent conditions. In addition, any change of measurement units is applied at this stage.

Parameters:
applyValCond - is true to apply the value conditions, false otherwise
Returns:
the conditioned set of forecasts and observations
Throws:
ConditioningException

canExecute

public boolean canExecute()
Returns true if the unit can be executed (i.e. all parameters are set), false otherwise.

Specified by:
canExecute in class AnalysisUnit
Returns:
true if the unit is ready to execute

isUseFullClimatology

public boolean isUseFullClimatology()
Returns true if the full period of observed data will be used for climatology, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the full period of observed data will be used for climatology

willAggregatePairs

public boolean willAggregatePairs()
Returns true if the pairs will be aggregated, i.e. if the requested support of the pairs is greater than their native resolution, false otherwise. For aggregation to take place, the verificationResolution and associated units, verificationResolutionUnits, must be larger than both the observed support and the forecast support, since the pairing process leads to the forecasts and observations having the greater of these two supports as a prerequisite for pairing.

Returns:
true if the pairs will be aggregated, false otherwise, including if unknown

setSampleSizeConstraint

public void setSampleSizeConstraint(double sampleSizeConstraint)
Sets the fraction of pairs required at each lead time for that lead time to be included in the verification results. The fraction falls in [0,1] and is relative to the average number of pairs found across all lead times after applying all conditions and any temporal aggregation. For example, 0.5 implies that any lead time with fewer than 50% of the average number of pairs across all lead times will be eliminated.

Parameters:
sampleSizeConstraint - the sample size fraction

setVerifWindowInValidTime

public void setVerifWindowInValidTime(boolean verifWindowInValidTime)
Sets the time system for the verification window. If the input is true, the forecast valid time is used, otherwise the issue/basis time is used. By definition, observations are always in valid time. Pairs and forecasts may be in issue time/basis time.

Parameters:
verifWindowInValidTime - is true to set the verification window to forecast valid time, false to use issue/basis time

public void deleteAggregationUnits()
Deletes any aggregation units from the current verification unit and updates the associated aggregation units accordingly. If an aggregation unit contains only one other verification unit, all references to the aggregation unit are removed from the children verification units.

If the aggregation unit contains only one other verification unit, all references to the aggregation unit are removed from the children verification units.

Parameters:
agg - the aggregation unit to delete

deleteReferenceForecast

public boolean deleteReferenceForecast(java.lang.String id)
Delete the dependencies on the input reference forecast. If no metrics are defined that depend on the specified reference forecast, nothing is changed and a value of false is returned. If some metrics are defined that depend on the reference forecast, the specified reference forecast and any associated results are removed. If no remaining reference forecasts are defined, the metric is removed. In all cases where a change is made, a value of true is returned.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the reference forecast
Returns:
true if a change is made that relates to the reference forecasts

updateReferenceForecasts

public void updateReferenceForecasts(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> units)

Parameters:
units - the mapping of old VU names (keys) to new VU names (values)

getUnequalMetrics

public static java.lang.String[] getUnequalMetrics(java.util.ArrayList<VerificationUnit> units)
Returns a list of metrics that are not present in all inputs or whose parameter values are not equal across all inputs. Returns null if all metrics are present for all units and all have equal parameter values. Throws an exception if metrics have not been set for one or more of the inputs or if one of the inputs is null.

Returns:
a list of metrics that are absent in some of the inputs or have unequal parameter values

setApplyDateCondToClim

public void setApplyDateCondToClim(boolean applyDateCondToClim)
Apply date conditions to the sample climatology before determining thresholds corresponding to given climatological probabilities. This will not affect the calculation of skill scores with sample climatology as the baseline, as these are based on the paired data by default.

Parameters:
applyDateCondToClim - is true to apply date conditions to the climatology

setApplyValueCondToClim

public void setApplyValueCondToClim(boolean applyValueCondToClim)
Apply date conditions to the sample climatology before determining thresholds corresponding to given climatological probabilities. This will not affect the calculation of skill scores with sample climatology as the baseline, as these are based on the paired data by default.

Parameters:
applyValueCondToClim - is true to apply value conditions to the climatology

blindDeleteAggregationUnit

protected void blindDeleteAggregationUnit(AggregationUnit agg)
Removes an aggregation unit from the current verification unit without updating the aggregation unit to reflect the change. This is a convenience method to be called when deleting an aggregation unit, i.e. deleting the reference to that aggregation unit from every verification unit that it comprises.

Parameters:
agg - the aggregation unit
